article.headline: Boston U. 54, Hartford 40
article.story: BOSTON (AP) -- Bryan Geffen scored a career-high 15 points to lead Boston University to a 54-40 win over Hartford and give coach Dennis Wolff his 200th victory as coach of the Terriers on Wednesday night. Kevin Gardner had 10 points and 11 rebounds and Shaun Wynn added 10 points for BU (8-11, 5-3 America East), which never trailed. Hartford (7-11, 3-5) was led by Kenny Adeleke with 15 points and 14 rebounds, his 11th consecutive double-double. Aaron Cook had 11 points. The Hawks got as close as six in the second half on Adeleke's hook shot, but Gardner responded with a basket to spark an 8-0 run by BU over the next 1:25 for a 39-25 lead with 13:15 to play. The Terriers hit five 3-pointers in the first half, two each by Geffen and Wynn, and closed the half on a 7-0 run to take a 29-19 halftime lead. Hartford shot 35 percent from the field and 43 percent from the line in the game.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
